title: Aluminium prices rebound to USD 2,861.5/t; is the upswing sustainable?
summary: LME aluminium prices rose to USD 2,861.5 per tonne after a sharp fall, with both cash bid and offer contracts increasing by about 0.8-0.9%. However, the LME 3-month Asian Reference Price declined slightly, indicating a mixed market trend. LME inventory showed a slight decline, suggesting some tightening in supply.

title: Aluminium Prices Are On The Rise As US Premium At Record High
summary: Aluminium prices reached near 3-year highs with a 13% increase in 2025, driven by a record high US premium due to import tariffs and tight supply. The US market price for aluminium is significantly higher than the LME base price, causing increased costs for US consumers.

title: World's top aluminum producer adds markups as Trump tariffs drive costs
summary: Rio Tinto Group is imposing surcharges on aluminum shipments to the US, citing low inventories and rising demand. This move adds to the disruption in the North American market caused by import tariffs, which are increasing costs for consumers and complicating supply dynamics.

title: Aluminum prices are expected to hover at highs in the short term
summary: Aluminum prices are forecasted to remain high in the short term due to ongoing supply constraints and demand factors. Inventory levels and import dynamics in China are key influences on price stability.

title: World's top aluminum producer adds markups as Trump tariffs drive costs
summary: Rio Tinto Group, the world's leading aluminum producer, is imposing surcharges on aluminum shipments to the U.S. due to low inventories and rising demand. This move could further disrupt the North American aluminum market already affected by import tariffs, with the U.S. heavily reliant on imports, especially from Canada.

title: Decline of U.S. Primary Aluminum Production and the Growth of Secondary Aluminum
summary: U.S. primary aluminum production declined to 0.75 million tonnes in 2023, a 15% decrease from 2022, reflecting a continuing downward trend. Meanwhile, China has closed smaller smelters, consolidating capacity to just over 53 million tonnes per year, indicating shifts in global aluminum production capacity.

title: Aluminum prices are expected to hover at highs in the short term
summary: According to SMM statistics, aluminum prices are expected to remain high in the short term, influenced by market dynamics including supply constraints and demand factors.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Inert anode aluminum production technology can eliminate 95% of CO2 emissions from aluminum manufacturing while improving efficiency by up to 5%. If it reaches 50% market penetration by 2040-2045, it could reduce global aluminum production emissions by 400-700 million tonnes annually, enabling near-zero lifecycle emissions when powered by renewable energy.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever to launch personal care packaging with ELYSIS carbon-free aluminium
summary: Alcoa Corporation's ELYSIS process innovates aluminum production by generating oxygen instead of CO2, enabling carbon-free smelting. This technology is being used in new personal care packaging by Ball and Unilever, marking a significant step toward sustainable aluminum products.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball Corporation and Unilever are demonstrating the viability of green aluminum by using aluminum produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans. This partnership highlights practical applications of sustainable aluminum in consumer products.

title: Researchers make incredible breakthrough using material from old aluminum
summary: A new recycled aluminum alloy called RidgeAlloy has been developed, offering up to 95% reduction in energy use compared to primary aluminum. This breakthrough could significantly lower the environmental impact of aluminum production by utilizing remelted scrap.

title: 3 technologies helping the aluminium industry decarbonize
summary: The aluminum industry, responsible for about 3% of global industrial CO2 emissions, is adopting breakthrough technologies to reduce emissions. Innovations include impurity removal from recycled aluminum to expand its applications and partnerships supporting decarbonization efforts.

title: HRC Steel Price Falls Slightly on November 26, 2025
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel price fell to 898.05 USD/T on November 26, 2025, down 0.44% from the previous day. Despite the recent dip, HRC Steel prices have risen 4.91% over the past month and are up 28.32% compared to the same time last year.

title: Steel Prices and Market Data for Energy Traders and Analysts
summary: S&P Global provides comprehensive and real-time steel market prices, data, and analysis, helping market participants monitor price fluctuations and trends. Their resources include historical and spot prices, forward curves, and detailed market insights to support decision-making in the steel commodity market.

title: Steel Market News: Spain Increases Steel Production by 11.6% in October
summary: Spain's steel production rose by 11.6% month-over-month in October 2025. Other notable market developments include the US reducing imports of rolled steel by 7.6% in June and Acerinox considering price increases in the US market.

title: Steel Price Rises to 3,097 CNY/T on November 25, 2025
summary: Steel prices in China rose slightly by 0.19% to 3,097 CNY/T on November 25, 2025. Over the past month, steel prices increased by 0.32%, although they remain 5.78% lower compared to the previous year.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News Update - November 26, 2025
summary: SteelRadar provides up-to-date prices, news, and analyses for the global iron and steel industry, including futures prices for Turkey, India, Taiwan, China, Europe, and North America as of November 24, 2025. The platform offers comprehensive market transparency and insights.

title: Carney expected to announce support measures for steel industry hit by U.S. tariffs
source: The Globe and Mail / Global News - Canada
summary: The Canadian federal government plans to limit foreign steel imports and reduce interprovincial rail freight rates to support the domestic steel industry affected by U.S. tariffs. Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to announce new funding and tighter import limits to help Canadian steel producers fill domestic demand gaps.

title: Carney expected to announce new supports for steel industry hammered by U.S. tariffs
summary: The Canadian government aims to cut steel imports from countries without free trade agreements from 50% to 20% of 2024 levels, opening an estimated $854 million in domestic demand. Additionally, freight rates for interprovincial steel shipments may be cut by 50%, with subsidies if rail companies cannot comply, to support the steel sector amid U.S. tariff pressures.

title: Swedish steel company Alleima doubles production capacity in east China
summary: Alleima has launched a new cold-finishing plant in Zhenjiang, Jiangsu Province, doubling its production capacity in East China. The facility, representing a $27.2 million investment, will produce tubes for petrochemical, hydrogen refueling, paper, and healthcare sectors across Asia, aiming for faster delivery to customers.

title: Weekly Raw Steel Production Report - Week ending November 22, 2025
summary: Domestic raw steel production in the U.S. was 1,761,000 net tons with a capability utilization rate of 76.9% for the week ending November 22, 2025. This represents an 8.3% increase compared to the same period last year, indicating a positive production trend despite minor week-over-week fluctuations.

title: Trump makes golden share appointments to U.S. Steel
summary: President Donald Trump invoked his 'golden share' in U.S. Steel, appointing William Kimmitt as his designee with consent rights over key company decisions including capital investments and facility closures. This move signals increased government oversight in the U.S. steel industry amid ongoing trade and production challenges.

title: The Future of EU Steel Research - How to foster EU steel leadership
summary: This event in Mönchengladbach, Germany, focuses on advancing innovation and sustainability in Europe's steel industry. It highlights the Research Fund for Coal and Steel's role in driving decarbonization, competitiveness, and industrial transformation through breakthroughs in low to zero-emission steelmaking, energy efficiency, and circular economy solutions.

title: Boston Metal Names Industry Veteran Roy Harvey to Board of Directors
summary: Boston Metal, a company innovating in global metals production, announced the appointment of Roy Harvey, an industry veteran, to its board of directors. This move underscores the company's commitment to advancing steel technology innovation and sustainable metals production.

title: European Green Steel Summit 2025: shaping the future of the steel industry
summary: The 3rd European Green Steel Summit will address carbon emission reduction, green steel production, and innovative technologies. It aims to facilitate knowledge exchange on renewable energy, green hydrogen, carbon capture, smart manufacturing, and sustainability practices across the steel industry.

title: Steel Meets Innovation: Emerging Technologies Reshaping the Sector
summary: This article discusses how advances in AI and green steel technologies are transforming the steel industry. It highlights the adoption of smart manufacturing and sustainable production methods to meet growing demand while reducing environmental impact.

title: How Tencent uses prizes to accelerate progress to net zero
summary: Tencent announced finalists for CarbonX 2.0, a global competition supporting decarbonization solutions including carbon capture in the steel industry. The initiative aims to accelerate innovation in reducing emissions and achieving net zero targets.

title: Comex Copper Settles 0.76% Higher at $4.9995 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for November delivery rose 0.76% to $4.9995 per pound, marking gains in two of the past three sessions. Despite being down 13.73% from its 52-week high in July, copper is up 25.43% year-to-date, reflecting strong market performance overall.

title: Harmony Copper Mine Project Investment Approved, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing up 0.47% at $10,832.5/mt amid tight supply of high-quality copper and easing geopolitical risks such as potential Russia-Ukraine peace talks. US retail sales data falling short of expectations strengthened market hopes for a Fed interest rate cut, supporting copper prices despite some easing in downstream demand.

title: Copper prices steady as traders consider US data and progress in ending the shutdown
summary: Copper prices remained steady near $11,000 per ton despite weak near-term demand, supported by expectations of a US Federal Reserve interest rate cut in December. Market participants noted that a possible resolution to the US government shutdown could reduce uncertainties and restore economic data flow, while other base metals showed mixed movements.

title: Copper price highest in over a year on Grasberg disruption, Fed outlook
summary: Copper prices reached their highest level in more than a year, trading above $10,976 per ton, driven by supply disruptions at the Grasberg mine in Indonesia and expectations of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut. The supply challenges across South America and Africa have tightened global copper availability, fueling the price rally.

title: Copper rises as outflows to US stocks provide support - Markets
summary: Benchmark copper on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.8% to $10,855 per metric ton, supported by outflows to US stocks. The market showed positive momentum amid ongoing supply concerns and steady demand.

title: Copper rose to 5.03 USD/Lbs on November 26, 2025
summary: Copper futures climbed above $5 per pound, reaching a near two-week high as investors positioned ahead of a key industry gathering in Shanghai. The global copper-processing sector has faced record low annual treatment and refining charges as metal-processing capacity in China outpaced mined production. Prices were supported by signs of tightening supply, with Chile's Codelco proposing record premiums for 2026 metal sales.

title: Barrick committed to Pakistan's Reko Diq copper project, says interim CEO
summary: Barrick Mining Corp reaffirmed its commitment to the Reko Diq copper mine in Pakistan, one of the world's largest undeveloped deposits. The $7 billion project is expected to produce up to 400,000 tons of copper yearly and is scheduled to start production by the end of 2028.

title: Doubleview Gold Corp. Achieves a Major Breakthrough in Scandium Recovery from Copper Porphyry Tailings
summary: Doubleview Gold Corp achieved a global first in successfully recovering scandium from copper porphyry flotation tailings with 88% overall recovery to high-purity scandium oxide product. The breakthrough could enable scandium to become a high-margin bonus product alongside a potential world-class copper-gold-cobalt operation at the HAT project.

title: Codelco offers record premiums for 2026 copper sales to China
summary: Chile's state-owned Codelco proposed record premiums of $335 per ton for copper sales to some buyers, reflecting tightening supply conditions in the global copper market ahead of 2026 negotiations.

title: Doubleview Gold Corp. Achieves a Major Breakthrough in Scandium Recovery from Copper Porphyry Tailings
summary: Doubleview Gold Corp. announced a global first in successfully recovering high-purity scandium oxide from copper porphyry flotation tailings at its HAT polymetallic deposit in British Columbia. This breakthrough could add significant value by extracting scandium alongside copper, gold, cobalt, and other metals, with ongoing pilot testing planned to optimize recovery and purity.

title: Codelco's Record Premiums Signal a New Era for Copper Demand and Strategic Investment Opportunities
summary: Codelco, the world's largest copper producer, faces a 25% output decline due to mine collapse and aging infrastructure, amid surging demand driven by electric vehicles and AI data centers. Record premiums and prices reflect a structural market shift, with forecasts of significant annual deficits through 2026, prompting major investments in mine modernization and safety.

title: Copper is the New Gold, and We Are Running Out
summary: This article highlights how copper and other critical minerals are essential for the global energy transition and digital transformation. It emphasizes the role of circular economy practices, digital innovations such as AI and blockchain, and sustainable supply chain initiatives to address environmental sustainability and supply chain resilience in copper technology.

title: Copper's Role in the Energy Transition Grows as Demand Surges
summary: With intensifying supply pressures, copper companies are increasing production while embracing sustainability and digital innovations. Technologies like Advanced Work Packaging (AWP), Building Information Modeling (BIM), Geographic Information Systems (GIS), and digital twins are optimizing mining capital projects to improve efficiency, safety, and timely delivery.

title: New Technologies Could Refine the Copper the World Needs
summary: Emerging technologies aim to modernize copper refining and smelting processes to reduce pollution and environmental impact. Given copper's critical role in expanding renewable energy infrastructure, these innovations seek to replace outdated, polluting methods with cleaner, more sustainable alternatives.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Continue to Rebound on November 25
summary: Nickel prices rebounded on November 25 with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 118,550 yuan/mt, up 800 yuan/mt from the previous day. Market optimism rose due to dovish signals from the US Federal Reserve, increasing expectations for an interest rate cut in December, which supported nickel prices despite long-term pressure.

title: On November 26, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: On November 26, the SMM #1 refined nickel price rose further to an average of 119,850 yuan/mt, up 1,300 yuan/mt from the previous day, indicating continued short-term price recovery amid market fluctuations.

title: LME nickel price drops 3.7% on Nov 26
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel price fell by 3.7% on November 26, closing at US$19,897 per ton. This decline reflects ongoing volatility in the nickel market despite recent rebounds in some regions.

title: Market Update on Nickel Prices in Nov.2025
summary: Nickel prices have shown limited downward trends with potential for rebound due to macroeconomic factors including expectations of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. Supply-side uncertainties persist, but demand from stainless steel and new energy battery sectors supports nickel sulfate prices. High inventory pressure may limit recovery potential.

title: Nickel prices surge due to weaker dollar, strong service PMI & LME inventory slightly declines
summary: Nickel spot prices increased by US$116/ton to US$15,865/ton, supported by a weaker US dollar and strong service sector PMI data. LME nickel inventory decreased slightly by 78 tons, contributing to the price surge amid market uncertainty.

title: Indonesia's Nickel Supply & The Global Price Slump: What the Market Sell-Off Signals for Investors
summary: Nickel prices have fallen to $14,550 per tonne, near a four-year low, due to Indonesia's refinery expansion flooding the market and causing oversupply. Despite Indonesia's planned quota cuts, market skepticism remains about their impact on tightening supply. LME inventories surged by 90,000 tonnes in 2025, with stainless steel demand weak but EV battery growth providing some long-term support.

title: Nickel Falls to 7-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures in the UK dropped to $14,550 per tonne in November 2025, the lowest since a four-year low in April, due to mounting oversupply largely driven by Indonesia's over-expansion of its nickel sector. Prices have fallen 2.99% over the past month and 6.56% year-over-year, reflecting ample output despite export restrictions implemented since 2020.

title: Waste constraints hit output at major Indonesia nickel plant
summary: A major Chinese-owned nickel processing plant in Indonesia's key production hub has reduced output due to waste management constraints. This development adds complexity to the already oversupplied nickel market dominated by Indonesia's refinery expansion.

title: Nickel mining in North America: it's a US national security issue
summary: The Eagle Mine in Michigan produced 17,000 tons of nickel in 2023, serving as a crucial domestic source for the US market, but this is insufficient compared to over 159,000 tons imported. New mining projects like Aston Minerals' Edleston Project in Canada and Talon's nickel concentrate supply agreement with Tesla highlight efforts to secure North American nickel supply amid national security concerns.

title: FPX Nickel secures ECOLOGO certification for sustainable practices
summary: FPX Nickel has achieved UL Solutions ECOLOGO certification, marking a significant milestone in sustainable mineral exploration. This certification reflects the company's commitment to transparency, accountability, and minimizing environmental impacts, making it the first Canadian company outside Quebec to earn this recognition.

title: Battery X Metals Announces New Strategic Partnership with Global Top 20 University
summary: Battery X Metals has partnered with a leading university to develop an eco-friendly froth-flotation process for recovering critical battery materials including nickel from end-of-life lithium-ion batteries. This innovation aims to create a circular, resource-efficient supply chain that reduces environmental impact and supports North America's clean energy ecosystem.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: NOVONIX's Director of R&D discusses a patented, all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology that could significantly reduce costs and environmental impacts of nickel-based cathode production. The article highlights ongoing innovations and sustainability efforts in nickel production and the critical role of nickel in the energy transition.

title: 3 Questions: Can we secure a sustainable supply of nickel?
summary: MIT researchers analyze the challenges and opportunities in securing a sustainable supply of nickel, essential for electric vehicle batteries and clean energy technologies. The study addresses environmental, economic, and community impacts of nickel mining and explores strategies to balance demand with sustainability.

title: Indonesian coastal villages in the dark over nickel pollution
summary: Environmental violations at Indonesia's Morowali Industrial Park highlight ongoing nickel pollution issues affecting local coastal communities. Experts call for stricter sustainability standards to ensure responsible mining practices, warning that failure to improve could reduce global demand for Indonesian nickel.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of producing green hydrogen at its plant in Aosta, Italy. The project aims to reduce carbon emissions by using a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of hydrogen annually, enough to power one of its 70 furnaces and prevent up to 26 tons of carbon emissions per ton of hydrogen. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali SpA Announces Its Commitment to Sustainability with ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has embarked on the path to obtain ResponsibleSteel™ certification, formalizing its commitment to sustainability, environmental protection, and transparency. The company emphasizes that sustainability is integral to its daily operations and aims to create lasting value for employees, customers, and local communities through responsible steel production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a €200 million share capital increase and acquired Special Melted Products in the UK, expanding its portfolio and strengthening its position in the stainless steel and nickel alloy markets. This strategic move supports the company’s growth and vertical integration plans.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali signs agreement to acquire 65% stake in Com.Steel Inox
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali signed a contract to acquire a 65% stake in Com.Steel Inox SpA, enhancing its production capabilities and market reach. This acquisition is part of the company’s strategy to expand its presence in the stainless steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali posts lower income for 2023 amid difficult macroeconomic situation
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali reported a decrease in income for the fiscal year 2023 due to a disappointing market and challenging macroeconomic conditions affecting the steel sector. The company’s CFO highlighted the tough market environment impacting most players in the industry.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported Q3 2025 sales of $3 billion, up 2% year-on-year, with the board approving an interim dividend of $0.29 per share payable November 26, 2025. The company's tubular products and services sales held up well, particularly from Rig Direct customers in the US and Canada, though margins are expected to be affected by increased tariff costs in the fourth quarter.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts 2% rise in quarterly net sales
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris posted a 2% rise in net sales for the third quarter. As the world's No. 1 producer of steel pipes for the oil and gas industries, the company generates 95.4% of its revenue from pipe production with geographic distribution across North America (45.6%), Asia/Pacific/Middle East/Africa (25.5%), South America (19.3%), and Europe (9.6%).

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris earned $37 million in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter, though down 22.9% year-over-year. The company maintains steady sales in the North American oil and gas tube market, with resilient drilling activity despite recent tariff increases on steel imports.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian's innovation strategy is strongly driven by its Milan R&D center, with significant investments in Italy totaling €216 million between 2021 and 2024 and plans for an additional €270 million by 2028. The company focuses on high-voltage terrestrial and submarine transmission systems and renewable energy integration, supported by Italian government funding and strategic partnerships.

title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
summary: Bank of America projects Prysmian could benefit significantly from US copper tariffs, potentially increasing copper cable prices by 10% and boosting 2026 EBITDA by up to EUR1 billion. This advantage stems from Prysmian's US-based copper cable production after acquiring Encore Wire, with the greatest benefits expected in medium- and low-voltage segments.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Prysmian has raised its full-year 2025 financial guidance following a record third quarter, reflecting strong revenue growth and operational performance. The company continues to capitalize on its global footprint and innovation in cable technologies, reinforcing its market leadership.
